name: sharpen
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something sharp or sharper

example.eg: My pencil is blunt - I'll have to sharpen it.
example.egtrans: 我的铅笔钝了——我得削一下。

example.eg: The company is cutting production costs in an attempt to sharpen its competitive edge (= in order to improve how competitive it is).
example.egtrans: 这家公司正降低生产成本，以增强竞争力。

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: Recent changes have sharpened competition between the airlines.
example.egtrans: 近来的种种变化加剧了航空公司之间的竞争。

example.eg: The prison riots have sharpened the debate about how prisons should be run.
example.egtrans: 监狱暴动加剧了有关监狱该如何管理的争论。

example.eg: I hope this course will help me sharpen my computer skills.
example.egtrans: 我希望这门课程能帮助我提高电脑操作技能。

example.eg: I went to university to sharpen my mind.
example.egtrans: 我上大学是为了让自己的头脑更加敏锐。

example.eg: We'll need to sharpen our wits if we're going to defeat Jack's team.
example.egtrans: 要击败杰克的队，我们需要更加聪明一些。

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

example.eg: How do you sharpen the focus on this camera?
example.egtrans: 这台相机的焦距怎么调清楚呢？

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something play a higher musical note
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使提高音调；使提高半音

example.eg: You need to sharpen the A string on your violin.
example.egtrans: 你小提琴上的 A 弦应升半音。
